DataElement.preferredName: Alcohol Past 30 Days Frequency Use Alcohol Consumption Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value that represents, during the past 30 days, how many days per week or per month a person drank any alcoholic beverages, on the average.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A volatile liquid prepared by fermentation of certain carbohydrates. Alcohol acts as a central nervous system (CNS) depressant, a diuretic, and a disinfectant. Although the exact mechanism of CNS depression is unknown, alcohol may act by inhibiting the opening of calcium channels, mediated by the binding of the inhibitory neurotransmitter gamma-amino butyric acid (GABA) to GABA-A receptors, or through inhibitory actions at N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA)-type glutamate receptors. Alcohol inhibits the production of antidiuretic hormone, thereby producing diuresis that may lead to dehydration. This agent kills organisms by denaturing their proteins._A period of time consisting of the 30 days before the present._The number of occurrences of something within a given time period._A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

Concepts.definition: A volatile liquid prepared by fermentation of certain carbohydrates. Alcohol acts as a central nervous system (CNS) depressant, a diuretic, and a disinfectant. Although the exact mechanism of CNS depression is unknown, alcohol may act by inhibiting the opening of calcium channels, mediated by the binding of the inhibitory neurotransmitter gamma-amino butyric acid (GABA) to GABA-A receptors, or through inhibitory actions at N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA)-type glutamate receptors. Alcohol inhibits the production of antidiuretic hormone, thereby producing diuresis that may lead to dehydration. This agent kills organisms by denaturing their proteins.

Concepts.definition: A period of time consisting of the 30 days before the present.
The number of occurrences of something within a given time period.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The average number of alcoholic drinks consumed by the participant.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Observations and activities relating to behavior, such as smoking and ETOH use.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A symbol or string of symbols expressing value, quantity, or identification. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ReferenceDocuments.name: During the past 30 days, how
ReferenceDocuments.description: During the past 30 days, how many days per week or per month did you drink any alcoholic beverages, on the average?

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: During the past 30 days, how many days per week or per month did you drink any alcoholic beverages, on the average?    (Enter number of days you drank based on the timeframe checked below.  Enter 0 if you did not drink.)

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP Instruction
ReferenceDocuments.description: Enter a whole number (i.e. "4") only. Do not enter a range or fraction.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP-Text-2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Enter number of days you drank based on the timeframe checked below.  Enter 0 if you did not drink.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP-Text-3
ReferenceDocuments.description: During the past 30 days, how many days per week or per month did you drink any alcoholic beverages, on the average? Enter number of days you drank based on the timeframe checked below. Enter 0 if you did not drink.
